content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: After adding a precision on the possible separators for decimals, I can only accept this contribution to the community, it would be a fun CoC honnestly!

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very nice and simple task for CoC.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fairly simple clash, just requires some string manipulation and formatting outputs to have 2 decimal places even when the second place is "0".

Solvable in Reverse, but I would also recommend just allowing it for Shortest/Fastest also (and removing the line about it being Reverse only in the description).
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

This took me a while to solve because there was no indication that it would be using commas. It took me looking at the solution in order to find that out. Maybe adding something saying that it can apply to more then just periods would be beneficial.
This definitely seems like it would work best as a reverse puzzle as it's mostly just formatting your output correctly.

Cette contribution est des plus intÃ©ressantes parce que parraissant simple du premier regard, elle a sa part de difficultÃ©. NÃ©anmoins, elle requiert un peu plus de prÃ©cision Ã  propos de la somme permettant de passer les autres tests hormis le premier.
i agree with TJT, it's a good reverse puzzle.

I'm learning to write in python and I tested your contribution,
I liked it because it allowed me to see the comma numbers a little better and if it's for a clash of code I might have preferred if there were only spaces and commas for the separators, it allows me to make the exercise more readable without losing the interest of text formattingðŸ‘
If this is reverse only, it shouldn't need to be explained. This way, approvers can experience it like how the players will.
